template.name: Intel RST with js
template.description:
## Overview
This template is for discovering and monitoring Intel RST (Intel VROC) storage controllers. Works with zabbix 4.2 and higher. Template uses action with zabbix API.
Instuctions is on github page
<https://github.com/mykolq/zabbix_intel_rst_template>

item.name: Intel RST All Info
item.description: Get all info from rst controller(cli path + 'I' key)

item.name: Intel RST All Pds LLD info
item.description: JSON for lld of physical disks and for SMART template

item.name: RST cli path
item.key: wmi.get[root\cimv2,select DriverVersion from Win32_PnPSignedDriver WHERE DriverProviderName like '%Intel%' and DeviceClass like 'SCSIADAPTER' and not DeviceName like '%Ethernet Virtual Storage%']
item.description: Path to needed version of utility (depends on driver version)

trigger.name: {ITEM.VALUE}
trigger.description: Changing if driver version for Irst changed or if it's first check

trigger_prototype.name: Intel RST: Logical disk "{#LDNAME}" state was changed from "Degraded" state to "{ITEM.VALUE}"
Intel RST: Logical disk "{#LDNAME}" state was changed from "Failed" state to "{ITEM.VALUE}"

trigger_prototype.expression: {Intel RST with js:irst.raid.state.[{#LDNAME}].regexp({$LD_HIGH_SEVERITY_STATES})}=1 and {Intel RST with js:irst.raid.level.[{#LDNAME}].last()}>0 and {Intel RST with js:irst.raid.pdcount.[{#LDNAME}].last()}>0
trigger_prototype.name: Intel RST: Logical disk "{#LDNAME}" is "{ITEM.VALUE1}". LD level: {ITEM.VALUE2} Disks count: {ITEM.VALUE3}
Intel RST: Physical disk "{#SLOT}" was replaced by sn "{ITEM.VALUE}"

trigger_prototype.expression: {Intel RST with js:irst.pd.state.["{#SLOT}"].iregexp({$PD_INFORMATION_SEVERITY_STATES})}=1 and {Intel RST with js:irst.pd.sn.["{#SLOT}"].strlen()}>0
trigger_prototype.name: Intel RST: Physical disk "{#SLOT}" is "{ITEM.VALUE1}". Disk SN is "{ITEM.VALUE2}"

trigger_prototype.expression: {Intel RST with js:irst.pd.state.["{#SLOT}"].iregexp({$PD_WARNING_SEVERITY_STATES})}=1 and {Intel RST with js:irst.pd.sn.["{#SLOT}"].strlen()}>0
trigger_prototype.name: Intel RST: Physical disk "{#SLOT}" is "{ITEM.VALUE1}". Disk SN is "{ITEM.VALUE2}"

dependency.name: Intel RST: Physical disk "{#SLOT}" is "{ITEM.VALUE}". Disk SN is "{ITEM.VALUE2}"
dependency.expression: {Intel RST with js:irst.pd.state.["{#SLOT}"].iregexp({$PD_HIGH_SEVERITY_STATES})}=1 and {Intel RST with js:irst.pd.sn.["{#SLOT}"].strlen()}>0

trigger_prototype.expression: {Intel RST with js:irst.pd.state.["{#SLOT}"].iregexp({$PD_HIGH_SEVERITY_STATES})}=1 and {Intel RST with js:irst.pd.sn.["{#SLOT}"].strlen()}>0
trigger_prototype.name: Intel RST: Physical disk "{#SLOT}" is "{ITEM.VALUE}". Disk SN is "{ITEM.VALUE2}"

macro.description: Time interval for saving data. For debagging use you can set not null
Time interval for getting internal information for template. Like driver version for controllers
Logical disks high severity states (using in regex of triggers)
Logical disks information severity states (using in regex of triggers)
Logical disks recovery states (using in regex of triggers)
Logical disks warning severity states (using in regex of triggers)
Physical disks high severity states (using in regex of triggers)
Physicall disks recovery states (using in regex of triggers)
Physicall disks warning severity states (using in regex of triggers)
Time interval for getting all information from storage contrroller
